sentences.en: As we drove towards the desert, the vegetation became sparse.
sentences.cn: 我们驱车前往沙漠, 沿途的草木渐渐变得稀疏.

sentences.en: He was a tubby little man in his fifties, with sparse hair.
sentences.cn: 他50来岁，头发稀疏，身材矮胖。

sentences.en: Heath wrote us a letter friendly in tone, sparse in content.
sentences.cn: 希思给我们写了一封语调友善 、 内容空泛的信.

sentences.en: His pink scalp gleamed through his sparse hair.
sentences.cn: 他发红的头皮在稀疏的头发下泛微光.

sentences.en: Kangaroos compete with sheep and cattle for sparse supplies of food and water.
sentences.cn: 袋鼠与牛羊争夺稀少的食物和水。

sentences.en: Many slopes are rock fields with sparse vegetation.
sentences.cn: 许多山坡都是石头地，植被稀疏。

sentences.en: She went in to fix the sparse evening meal.
sentences.cn: 她走进屋去准备简单的晚餐.

sentences.en: Tenasserim had a very sparse population.
sentences.cn: 丹那沙林人口密度不大.

sentences.en: The experienced personnel , enlisted and officers alike , were a sparse lot.
sentences.cn: 有经验的老手, 无论官也好兵也好, 都廖廖无几.

sentences.en: The sparse line of spectators noticed nothing unusual.
sentences.cn: 那一排稀稀落落的观众没留意到任何不寻常之处。

sentences.en: the sparse population of the islands
The sparse vegetation will only feed a small population of animals.
sentences.cn: 稀疏的植物只够喂养少量的动物.

sentences.en: Traffic was sparse on the highway.
